tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: A Country Road: The Nationals
programme.desc: A rollicking political and social history across time and this vast country, presented by Heather Ewart. Episode 1 explores the National Partys early years plus what many consider its heyday during the 70s and 80s.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa Georgiadis gets an experts top turf tips, Sophie Thomson visits a garden designed for time-poor gardeners, Paul West cooks up a storm in a school kitchen garden, and we meet a collage artist with a passion for nature.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Kitchen
programme.desc: Salty combinations of parma ham, creamy goats cheese and figgy wraps are simple to assemble, as are Nigellas spicy mini ribs and her irresistible crab cakes. And saving the day is Nigellas never failing hangover cure!

programme.title: You Cant Ask That
programme.desc: Insightful, irreverent, moving and unpredictable, this episode sets the record straight about what its really like to go into prison and come out the other side.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Chasing after Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug this week on Hard Quiz are experts in invasive animals, the Saw movies, Greek tragedy Medea, and sumo!

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.desc: Colin Lane gets on a roll, Danielle Walker shares her ride-on mower tips, Devaura needs her support teddy, and Kram is well... Kram. Somewhere amongst this, a quiz show happens ending with a performance by Grace Cummings.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: You Cant Ask That
programme.desc: 70 percent of Australian marriages will experience an affair, according to Sexual Health Australia - but not all will be found out. This group bravely take a seat to face some harsh questions sent in from the public.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Sophie Thomson gets a visit from a butterfly expert, Costa Georgiadis and Millie Ross travels to west Arnhem land, Josh Byrne dives into a seagrass revegetation project and Jerry Coleby-Williams talks Cats claw creepers.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Piano UK
programme.desc: Its the final concert at The Royal Festival. Can Claudia, Mika and Lang Lang get our four amateur pianists ready for the biggest performance of their lives?

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a prestigious chess match ends in murder, the team must work out how and why the killing was carried out. Meanwhile, the commissioner is confronted with his past by the very last person he was expecting to see. (Final)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Rita and James have just 230 thousand dollars to self-build a sustainable, off-grid family home for themselves and their two kids. They plan to use recycled plastic bags, milk cartons, home-made bricks, and an earthen floor.

programme.title: Piney: The Lonesome Pine
programme.desc: A cheerful five-year-old girl named Georgie gets to grow her very own pine tree, Piney, on her Grandpa Sids Christmas tree farm. Four years later, the day has finally arrived for Piney to become what he was planted to be.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Disappearing Deliveries
programme.desc: When Sophies online shopping parcels are delivered but never received she hires the Inbestigators to track them down.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: Pebbles Pet Shop Of Terrible Terrors!
programme.desc: The gang hatch a monster egg with Wanda Sykes.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: The Girls are charmed by the coolest girl in school.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: While the Farmers back is turned the Flock take the opportunity to have a game of football. When the ball accidentally lands inside the farmhouse, Shaun comes up with an ingenious disguise to help retrieve it.

programme.title: Dragons: Gift Of The Night Fury
programme.desc: The epic story of Hiccup and Toothless continues as they take flight in a thrilling, high-flying adventure to discover an island of never-before-seen dragons.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Grizz likes burritos. A lot. So much so that after a restaurant makes a Bear-Sized burrito, Grizz cant bring himself to eat such a majestic work of art. He carries the burrito everywhere.

programme.title: Fresh Off The Boat
programme.desc: Jessica reveals shocking details about her past that even Louis was not aware of during her U.S. citizenship interview. Meanwhile, the boys have a day off from school and attempt to take the family minivan out for a joyride.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Lego Star Wars, Rabbids, Retro Consoles And More
programme.desc: Its GGSP ICYMI, this time including a review of LEGO Star Wars, Mario + Rabbids: Sparks of Hope, and some of the oldest consoles youve never heard of.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going as the sun comes up with continuous music videos, from new releases to classics and the songs weve long forgotten.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Missing Solar System
programme.desc: Pixie is horrified when her space diorama goes missing and Miss Tan falsely accuses her of not doing her homework.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: The gang team up with Sherlock Holmes in London.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: A dainty princess comes to Townsville.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and the Flock discover that the Farmer has grand plans for their barn - that dont include them! Drastic action is needed if life on the farm is ever going to be the same again!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors are talking cancer and answering all the big questions: What is it? Why do people get it? How can it be treated? And how can you help someone going through it?

programme.title: Secret Life Of The Kangaroo
programme.desc: This three part series features one species of kangaroo, the Eastern Greys, which populate the woodland, pasture and forests of the Eastern side of Australia.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Mel B and Kiell Smith-Bynoe join Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker for an entertaining and off beat look at the topical news stories of the week.

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.sub-title: Its A Wonderful Life Piper Part 2
programme.desc: With time running out and the fate of The Next Step in her hands, Piper struggles to reignite the love of dance in everyone.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: When a great flood fills the valley, the Moomins find somewhere new to live - a floating theatre! But is somebody already living there?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The flock hijack a road line-painting machine and cause chaos while creating giant works of art in the field.

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: After an all-bean breakfast the teams must cross the island in silence to avoid being eaten by raptors. Thats right, this episode has dinosaurs...and lots of farting. The first team to reach the other side claims victory.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: Panda gets kidnapped by a pair of deranged French foxes.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven brings a mascot costume to life with Pearls magic shard in order to help his friend Peedee with his job, but the plan backfires when the mascot goes rogue.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: Phil is in North Yorkshire visiting Pam whose four bed semi is showing no signs of selling. Phil also visits David in Huddersfield who bought his stone weavers cottage back in the 80s.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a skydiver appears to have been murdered in mid-air, Neville and the team must explore the cut-throat world of social media.

programme.title: rage Vault: Director Diane Martel
programme.desc: From Mariah Carey to Ol Dirty Bastard, Kelis, Eve, Snoop Dogg and more, rage lines up clips directed by the late Diane Martel.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests Miles Jupp, Deirdre OKane and Phill Jupitus join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme non sequiturs on the quite interesting quiz that often strays off on a strange tangent.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant and comedian Thanyia Moore join Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker to tear apart the weeks biggest news stories with savage wit and wisdom.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: The girls must replace the Professors Christmas present on Christmas Eve.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When Marinettes class makes a short horror film, the lead actress is akumatized into a slimy monster that feeds off fear.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: The Book Of Hath
programme.desc: Werewolf Hunters invade Howlington and inadvertently discover a mysterious portal in the catacombs. Is this where all the strange creatures are coming from? And where are the twins?

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: Catapult your team member into distant scoring zones to earn points but if you miss youll be landing in a penalty zone filled with all kind of evil. The first team to reach 10,000 points wins.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: When the Bears realize whatever they build with snow comes to life they decide to build the biggest snow party of all time.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven looks like a hero when he forms a magic crystal bubble around himself to protect a girl he likes from danger, but then panics when he cant figure out how to turn the bubble off!

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Can a small, disposable lighter suddenly ignite with the force of several sticks of dynamite? And, the MythBusters put on their boots, chaps and cowboy hats to try and shoot down some popular Gunslinger myths.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: Phil is in Billericay in Essex with a family struggling to keep up with the demands of their property. And over in Southend-on-Sea, Phil comes to the aid of serial mover and octogenarian, June. (Final)

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The younglings discover a bird-like creature.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Out playing in the meadow, Holly, Ben and their friends find a broken toy robot. Holly fixes it with magic, but the robot does not behave as they thought it would, and soon it is trying to clean out the whole castle.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The fruit tea-loving bird-like characters watch a man load a lorry with parcels and study the concept of things being underneath other things. Narrated by Linda Bassett.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel cant wait to show Margaret all of the things they can do to celebrate Thank You Day at the Enchanted Garden!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its Bings birthday! He shows Sula, Pando and Coco how to do the waka-oke but Pando doesnt do it properly. Flop helps Bing understand that Pando does things differently to him.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Rabbit comes to visit with a big tummy. Everyone is excited to find out there is a baby rabbit inside, but they are in for an even bigger surprise!

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mr Brown has forgotten to get Mrs Brown a birthday present. Paddington decides to hold a surprise party.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: When a spell accidentally goes wrong, Ben and Holly grow to human size! Now they are able to play with Lucy and her friends and want to stay big forever!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are shocked to find their new bedrooms empty! Mummy and Daddy Pig tell them they will be the ones decorate their rooms, so they all go to a furniture shop to create the best rooms ever!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Big Trev is worried about passing his annual lifeguard fitness test, so Frizzy offers to help with an early morning boot camp.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Whilst exploring deep space, a meteor strikes Cosima and Dads ship! Crash-landing on the unexplored planet of Proxima, Cosima makes a new best friend - Big Lizard!

programme.title: Play School: Whats Cooking?
programme.desc: Alex and Rachael are looking for a delicious drink and scrumptious snack to eat! Luckily, food lover Melissa Leong is here to help them make super green smoothies and pink dragon fruit muffins.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups visit a fruit nursery where they embark on a competition to see who can grow the tallest fruit tree, but when things go wrong, will the MixMups find "another way" to be more fruitful?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its snack time for Bing but the only banana left is too mushy to eat. Flop suggests making a smoothie with it instead.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey promises her customer Bingo the best tour ever in a game of Whale Watching, but they need Mum and Dad to join in and they are too tired to play after a late night.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Join Mister Maker in South Africa as he makes a magnificent musical picture, in the UK we discover whether he can make a pompom hedgehog and in colourful Brazil a Mini Maker helps Mister Maker create a masterpiece.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.sub-title: The Slowest Race In The World
programme.desc: When Thomas, Kana, and Diesel "race" to see who can go the slowest, their lack of speed provides lots of challenges - and lets Thomas see small things he might have otherwise missed.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Grandpa Pigs birthday and the family go out for a celebratory meal. Peppa has never been to a restaurant before.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: The volcano is active which means the baby Pea-Rexes get to play Pea Shooter. Ginger manages to find her own way to join in.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Popcorn breaks the x-ray machine and does everything he can to fix it before Vida finds out.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Kwazii and the Octonauts help their friends the coconut crabs discover who is stealing their coconuts.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Hannah shows off a homemade kite, her stunts cause a barbequing accident, sparking multiple fires!

programme.title: Play School: My Place My Home
programme.desc: Teo is in the Torres Strait meeting a frill-necked lizard! Uncle Charles teaches Alex Taba Naba and with Rachael they make coconut milk. Little Ted drives his boat between islands to shop for a big feast!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and friends visit a Petting Farm where they enjoy feeding chickens and meeting cute and squeaky guinea pigs and they all learn its important to wash your hands after handling the little animals.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When a meteorite splashes into the sea Dad and Cosima cause problems by claiming it in the name of science, against the wishes of all the sea creatures.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Kangaroo Beach legend, King Kanga, is back and ready to rule the beach. But the cadets soon learn that he has a very different lifeguardingapproach.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Catboy wants to prove himself a brave Cat Explorer and realises that a true Cat Explorer puts his team before the discovery.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels are playing Copy the King when Tag falls over and bumps his knee. Ouch. Duggee has his First Aid badge, so he can bandage Tag up. The squirrels want to help too and they practice their bandaging on Happy.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea challenges The Tato Team to a football match but cheats with her "Cheaty Boots".

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi put their flying skills to the test.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle wants fish for dinner, so he goes out fishing with Mr Elf, Ben and Holly on Mr Elfs boat. Mr Elf tells them a story about the biggest, baddest fish ever - Big Bad Barry. The King wants to catch Barry for supper.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos are beside a river. They watch a fisherman cast out his line and then settle down for a nap. Chickedy and Chick run along the rod to the very end. Toodloo joins Chickedy and Chick.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel cant wait to show Margaret all of the things they can do to celebrate Thank You Day at the Enchanted Garden!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula, Pando and Bing find a birds nest in their playhouse, but learn they cant both be in it at the same time. Bing decides to give it to the bird... for now.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Pedro Pony spends the day just like a real cowboy would have in the Wild West: setting up camp in the garden and sharing stories with his friends.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington decides to make a scrapbook of memories and tries to include all his friends to show Aunt Lucy.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Granny Thistle comes to visit and gives Daisy and Poppy a powerful magical wand. The children escape from the castle and...go bananas!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today the new baby seat has arrived, but the family car has no room for it! With help from Peppa and George, Daddy Pig chooses a bigger car for the family.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Reef and Roadie are rejected from the cadets safety film, they disrupt the production with a set of pranks, but end up learning a valuable lesson about pretending to be in trouble when youre not.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When a pack of pesky migrating trilobites overrun the ship Big Lizard has to use a hidden talent to lure them away. But one little trilobite, Rex, decides to stay.

programme.title: Play School: Whats Cooking?
programme.desc: Time for dinner! Alex and Kaeng get a lesson in making roly poly rice paper rolls and yummy dipping sauce from legendary cook Nagi Maehashi. Alex, Kaeng and Nagi are joined by Nagis best mate, Dozer, for a picnic dinner.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups visit a zoo to see if they can see a real tiger. The Zoo Keeper Lucky Loover Bird takes them on safari but the tigers wont come out of hiding. Can the Mixmups find another way to entice them out?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing finds a frog in the garden and wants to keep it so he and Sula make the frog a house in a bucket. But froggy doesnt like her new home and hops out.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Dads accused of fluffing in Blueys face as he climbed out of bed, hes put on trial with Mum as the judge and Bluey and Bingo as witnesses. But what was Bluey doing there?

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In South Africa we find out whether Mister Maker can make some colourful creepy crawlies. In the UK, discover how to make an incredible igloo, and in the Far East a Mini Maker helps create an eye-catching ribbon picture.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: On a windy day, the team has to band together to get an important delivery done. When it seems like the elements will be too much, they find they can ask each other for help and get hard work done if they all work together.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its almost lunchtime at Peppa Pigs house. Mummy suggest they all make pizza together, they have a lot of fun preparing and mixing up all the food to make their own pizzas - its all so lovely and messy.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Fossilised honeysuckle is extremely yummy and extremely difficult to crack open. Ginger and the baby Pea-rexes must use all their clever thinking to open their prized meal.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Vida and Popcorns search for a mysterious stink in the Koala home leads to Pippens bad breath.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Decorator Crab
programme.desc: When important objects go missing from their ship, the Octonauts stake out the thief who turns out to be a decorator crab, stealing their things to decorate his shell.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The PJ Masks think Luna and Motsuki are causing moon trouble, but its actually Pharaoh Boy.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When James plans a cafe makeover for the Wholefish Cafe, he becomes over-zealous which leads to a series of events that cause a fire.

programme.title: Play School: My Place My Home
programme.desc: Teo is exploring Alice Springs where he meets a thorny devil, a perentie, and a woma python. Hunter and Abi make different animal tracks in the sand, and Scrap and Slush log on to their computers to attend school online!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go behind the scenes to find out how TV is made. Miss Rabbit shows them around the set of Super Potato.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard are helping Dad train for his astronaut fitness test. When Rex gets in to trouble Dads hard work finally pays off.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemmas obsession with a pair of passing whales distracts her from her duties. Meanwhile, one of the whales does some wombat watching and becomes beached.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The PJs offer to help Motsuki find Luna but they dont listen to the stressed out little moth, so they miss a plot by Night Ninja right under their noses.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee has a pot of bubble mixture, and hes blowing fantastic bubbles. Its really hard to do but most of the squirrels eventually get the hang of it, and the club rapidly fills up with lots of bubbles. Pop, pop, pop!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The veggies are showing off their superhero sidekick costumes in a contest that Supertato is judging.

programme.title: A Country Road: The Nationals
programme.desc: A rollicking political and social history across time and this vast country, presented by Heather Ewart. Episode 1 explores the National Partys early years plus what many consider its heyday during the 70s and 80s.

programme.desc: Its the final concert at The Royal Festival. Can Claudia, Mika and Lang Lang get our four amateur pianists ready for the biggest performance of their lives?

programme.desc: When a prestigious chess match ends in murder, the team must work out how and why the killing was carried out. Meanwhile, the commissioner is confronted with his past by the very last person he was expecting to see. (Final)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Rita and James have just 230 thousand dollars to self-build a sustainable, off-grid family home for themselves and their two kids. They plan to use recycled plastic bags, milk cartons, home-made bricks, and an earthen floor.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: The Pacific: Summer Special
programme.desc: In this Summer Special episode of The Pacific: we look at New Caledonias collapsing nickel industry and what it means for local workers, while uncovering allegations of abuse of Fijian labourers in Tonga.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Kirsten Aiken brings you reaction from markets, economists and borrowers after the Reserve Banks final decision on interest rates for 2025. The RBA is widely expected to leave rates on hold with inflation above target.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Culture By Design
programme.desc: Thoughtful design enhances daily lives in ways we dont always notice. Learn about the creatives who practice forward-thinking designs in Mumbai (furniture design), Yogyakarta (ceramics), and Central Java (bamboo bikes).

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Stephanie Borys is live from Parliament House in Canberra with the latest in politics, national and global affairs, speaking with politicians, key players and expert guests on the issues making news. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Spies In The Outback
programme.desc: The Cold War has finally ended but Pine Gap is expanding and its getting involved in conflicts across the world. We hear from someone whos been on the inside, meeting a spy whos spent years working within the razor wire.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Patricia Piccinini, the artist who creates strange creatures from the frontiers of science and technology, tells us of the future that is already here and why she is compelled to "create the worlds" that live in her mind.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Play On
programme.desc: Paul Kennedy visits The Bachar Houli Foundation which helps young Muslim Australians. Plus after a number drownings among the Indian migrant community, Dr Harpreet Kandra Singh set up swimming classes. (Final)

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: The Pacific: Summer Special
programme.desc: In this Summer Special of The Pacific: we investigate the scale of illegal fishing across the region and the toll its taking on Pacific nations. Plus we explore how growing militarisation in Palau is reshaping daily life.
